# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_internal/distributions/base.py
@source-hash: 41e07daaf2970c88
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:58:26Z

## Purpose
Base abstract class for handling installable Python package artifacts in pip's distribution system. Defines the contract for all distribution types that pip can install.

## Core Components

**AbstractDistribution (L11-53)** - Abstract base class defining the interface for installable artifacts
- Constructor (L30-32): Takes an `InstallRequirement` and stores it as `self.req`
- `build_tracker_id` property (L34-40): Abstract property returning Optional[str] for unique build tracking identification
- `get_metadata_distribution()` method (L42-44): Abstract method returning `BaseDistribution` for metadata access
- `prepare_distribution_metadata()` method (L46-53): Abstract method handling distribution preparation with finder, build isolation, and dependency checking

## Key Dependencies
- `pip._internal.metadata.base.BaseDistribution` - Metadata distribution interface
- `pip._internal.req.InstallRequirement` - Requirement specification
- `pip._internal.index.package_finder.PackageFinder` - Package discovery (TYPE_CHECKING only)

## Architecture Notes
- Uses ABC pattern to enforce implementation contract across different distribution types
- Build tracker integration is optional (None build_tracker_id skips preparation)
- Separates metadata retrieval from preparation phases
- Type checking imports used to avoid circular dependencies

## Invariants
- All subclasses must implement the three abstract methods
- build_tracker_id determines whether prepare_distribution_metadata is called
- Constructor requires valid InstallRequirement instance
